intro: Jussiaea myrtifolia var. sericea, commonly known as silky jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
